item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Faith is taking the first step even when you can't see the whole staircase." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Dag Hammarskjöld
item.description:
"Humility is just as much the opposite of self-abasement as it is of self-exaltation. To be humble is not to make comparisons. Secure in its reality, the self is neither better nor worse, bigger nor smaller, than anything else in the universe. It *is*--is nothing, yet at the same time one with everything. It is in this sense that humility is absolute self-effacement.
To be nothing in the self-effacement of humility, yet, for the sake of the task, to embody its whole weight and importance in your earing, as the one who has been called to undertake it. To give to people, works, poetry, art, what the self can contribute, and to take, simply and freely, what belongs to it by reason of its identity. Praise and blame, the winds of success and adversity, blow over such a life without leaving a trace or upsetting its balance." -- Dag Hammarskjöld

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "But of works of art little can be said. " -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Katie MacAlister
item.description: "Honest to god, Clare, you act like the dress is more important than you being shot!” Of course it is! It’s a Versace, you idiot! Bring help! I’m going to save this dress at all costs.” - Sam to Clare" -- Katie MacAlister

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "My bounty is as boundless as the sea, My love as deep; the more I give to thee, The more I have, for both are infinite." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "We know what we are, but not what we may be." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Wassily Kandinsky
item.description: "The artist must be blind to distinction between 'recognized' or 'unrecognized' conventions of form, deaf to the transitory teaching and demands of his particular age." -- Wassily Kandinsky

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Amy Vanderbilt
item.description: "Good manners have much to do with the emotions. To make them ring true, one must feel them, not merely exhibit them." -- Amy Vanderbilt

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "No man can be called friendless who has God and the companionship of good books." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Kimberly add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "God's gifts put men's best dreams to shame." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning
